Managerial Accounting

The module consists of topics on management accounting in which the application is focus on hospitality industry. The first part provides the student with the genera framework for cost and revenue allocation and how these costs and revenue are allocated to different departments. The second part introduces the students on breakeven analysis using graphs and formula approach. Students are also given opportunities to analyze various profit and loss statements using variable and absorption costing techniques.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Describe the general framework for cost and revenue allocations.

+  List the various types of costs and be able to allocate them to different departments.

+  Perform break even analysis using graphical and formula approach.

+  Analyze cost operating statements and profit and loss statements using variable and absorption costing techniques.

+  Make use of variable costing and variance analysis for budget decision making.

+  Explain the concept of budgetary control process for managerial decisions.
